item.title: City Repair Portland
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=7&v=uxDIgm14DLc Respectful Revolution Published on Mar 28, 2017 Mark Lakeman is a famous architect in Portland, OR. Why? After traveling around the world and seeing many cities from different cultures, Mark realized that one thing was missing from American cities: squares and plazas. Americans don’t connect on the streets because there’s no place to do so. Streets are designed for motorized traffic. Intersections aren’t made to hang out.
